newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Jinhai applies to issue 21.50 million A shares.
newsitem.headline: Jinhai applies to issue 21.50 million A shares.

text.p: Hainan Jinhai Co Ltd has filed an application with the China Securities Regulatory Commission (CSRC) to make an offer of 21.50 million A shares and list the equity in Shenzhen, a company spokeswoman said on Tuesday.

Jinhai has also applied to the CSRC to float 7.80 million staff shares, issued at one yuan per share, along with the A shares, the spokeswoman told the Hong Kong-based newsletter China Securities Bulletin.
Jinhai, based in Haikou, the capital of Hainan province, is chiefly engaged in processing nonferrous metals, the official said.
She said Jinhai's share offer application is being supported by the China National Nonferrous Metals Industry Corporation.
Jinhai aims to inject the proceeds from the offer into its main business, she said.
The official said Jinhai is forecasting net earnings of 18.53 million yuan for 1996. She did not provide any comparative figures.
Jinhai now has total share capital of 65 million shares, comprising 39.315 million founder shares, 12.685 million legal person shares and 13 million internal staff shares.
The official said Shanghai Guotai Securities has been named the chief underwriter for the offer and Jinhai's listing promoter.
